info.title: OPERA Cloud API for Customer Management Service
info.description:
This API deals with the different aspect of the CustomerManagement.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 22.3.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2023 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

get.description:
You can fetch a list of Calendar Tasks for with this API, for one or more properties.

OperationId:getCalendarTasks

parameters.name: countSummary
parameters.description: Indicator whether summary count will be retrieved or not.

parameters.name: taskSummary
parameters.description: Indicator whether task summary will be retrieved or not.

parameters.name: hotelIds
parameters.description: List of Hotel codes of calendar task.

parameters.name: completionStatus
parameters.description: Defines completion status codes of calendar task.

parameters.name: priorityCodes
parameters.description: List of priority levels of calendar task.

parameters.name: classCodes
parameters.description: Defines classification codes of calendar task.

parameters.name: typeCodes
parameters.description: List of types of calendar task based on its classification.

parameters.name: purpose
parameters.description: Brief description and purpose of calendar task.

parameters.name: taskOwner
parameters.description: Owner code of the person to whom the calendar task is assigned.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Author of the calendar task.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: accountIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: accountIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: contactIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: contactIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: blockId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: blockIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: blockIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

delete.description:
Delete an attachment associated with the calendar task

OperationId:deleteCalendarTaskAttachment

parameters.name: linkedToId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: attachId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.description:
With this API you can get a Calendar Task.

OperationId:getCalendarTask

parameters.name: idContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

post.description:
This API will allow you to create a new Calendar Task.

OperationId:postCalendarTask

parameters.name: calendarTask
parameters.description: Request to create calendar task.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.description:
Retrieve the attachments on a Calendar task.

OperationId:getCalendarTaskAttachments

parameters.name: idContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

200.description: Response for fetching calendar task attachments.

put.description:
This API will allow you to update an existing Calendar Task.

OperationId:putCalendarTask

parameters.name: calendarTask
parameters.description: Request to update calendar task.

delete.description:
This API will allow you to delete a Calendar Task.

OperationId:deleteCalendarTask

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

post.description:
Create a new Track It Item. Track It manages storage and delivery of guest luggage, parcels, vehicles (valet), and lost items. They can optionally be linked to a reservation if related or an arrival, in-house or departure reservation.

OperationId:postTrackItItems

parameters.name: trackItItems
parameters.description: Request object to create Track It items.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
Update the details of a Track It Item for a property.

OperationId:putTrackItItems

parameters.name: trackItItems
parameters.description: Request object to update Track It items.

200.description: Response object for updating Track It items.

delete.description:
Delete a Track It Item for a property.

OperationId:deleteTrackItItems

parameters.name: trackItId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: trackItIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: trackItIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all Track It Items for a property.

OperationId:getTrackItItems

parameters.name: ticketId
parameters.description: Complete ticket number of the Track It item.

parameters.name: reservationId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: reservationIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: reservationIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: givenName
parameters.description: Given name, first name or names.

parameters.name: surname
parameters.description: Family name, last name. May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

parameters.name: trackItGroups
parameters.description: Group to which the Track It items belong.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Track It types based on the Track It group.

parameters.name: locations
parameters.description: Locations for Track It location.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: Track It actions based on Track It groups.

parameters.name: actionStatuses
parameters.description: Action status of the Track It item(Open, Closed).

parameters.name: appUserId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: appUserIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: appUserIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: assignedStatuses
parameters.description: Assignment status of the Track It item(Assigned, Unassigned).

parameters.name: room
parameters.description: Guest's room number if ticket associated with a reservation.

parameters.name: followUpDate
parameters.description: Follow up date for the ticket.

parameters.name: createdOn
parameters.description: Date when the ticket was created.

parameters.name: createdByUserId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: createdByUserIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: createdByUserIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description associated with the Track It item.

200.description: Response object that retrieves Track It items.

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

x-hubid.name: x-hubid
x-hubid.description: x-hubid is a logical grouping of multiple properties that allows api consumers to manage data from a group of properties. This x-hubid is a valid list of hub codes configured in OPERA to which the user has access. Rest APIs without hotelId in the operation path can support hub level integration using x-hubid

completedBy.description: Name of person who completed the task. Ignored when task is not marked as completed.

completedOn.description: Date on which the task was completed. Ignored when task is not marked as completed.

completed.description: Whether the task is completed or not.

typeCode.description: Type of calendar task based on its classification.

purpose.description: Brief description and purpose of calendar task.

notes.description: Additional notes and information regarding calendar task.

taskOwner.description: Owner code of the person to whom the calendar task is assigned.

accountIdList.description: List of Accounts that are linked with the calendar task.

contactIdList.description: List of Contacts that are linked with the calendar task.

blockIdList.description: List of Blocks that are linked with the calendar task.

attachmentsCount.description: Count of the attachments that are attached to the task.

url.description: URL that identifies the location associated with the record identified by the UniqueID.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

idContext.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

idExtension.description: Additional identifying value assigned by the creating system.

timeSpanType.description: Allows for a choice in description of the amount of time spanned by this type. EndDate specifies a specific date, while Duration provides a measure of time to add to the StartDate to yield end date.

calendarTaskPriorityType.description: Calendar Task code, description and color This will be used for calendar task priorities.

codeDescriptionType.description: This contains a generic code and description information.

calendarTaskClassType.description: Defines classification codes of calendar task.

uniqueNameIDListType.description: Defines descriptive name and unique identification combination.

uniqueNameIDType.description: Defines descriptive name, unique identification, and basic information combination.

primaryInd.description: When true, indicates a primary information.

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

calendarTaskCountListType.description: Defines summary count of calendar tasks that belongs to specific classification.

calendarTaskCountType.description: Defines summary count of calendar tasks that belongs to specific classification.

taskOwner.description: Owner code of the person to whom the calendar task is assigned.

outstandingCount.description: Total number of outstanding calendar tasks under specific classification.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

status.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

calendarTaskAttachments.description: Response for fetching calendar task attachments.
Collection of information about calendar task attachments returned/fetched as per the criteria in the fetch request.

global.description: Flag to say if attachment is available across properties.

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

trackItItems.description: Response object that retrieves Track It items.

trackItItemType.description: Detailed information of a Track It item.

trackItId.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

url.description: URL that identifies the location associated with the record identified by the UniqueID.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

idContext.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

idExtension.description: Additional identifying value assigned by the creating system.

trackItGroup.description: Group to which the Track It items belong.

trackItType.description: Identifies the kind of Parcel, Baggage, or Lost items or Valet-managed vehicles or services.

uRLType.description: Web site address, in IETF(The Internet Engineering Task Force) specified format.

type.description: Defines the purpose of the URL address, such as personal, business, public, etc.

primaryInd.description: When true, indicates a primary information.

trackItActionType.description: Identifies the response expected from staff or other parties relative to a Track It ticket.

actionStatusType.description: Action status of the Track It item(Open, Closed).

userSessionInfo.description: This is only used during log-in.

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

gender.description: Identifies the profile gender code selected from Gender types List of values. Gender types LOV provides the values configured at gender configuration.

birthDate.description: Indicates the date of birth as indicated in the document, in ISO 8601 prescribed format.

birthDateMasked.description: Indicates the date of birth as masked.

personNameType.description: This provides name information for a person.

namePrefix.description: Salutation of honorific (e.g. Mr., Mrs., Ms., Miss, Dr.)

givenName.description: Given name, first name or names.

middleName.description: The middle name of the person name.

surname.description: Family name, last name. May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

nameSuffix.description: Hold various name suffixes and letters (e.g. Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.)

nameTitleSuffix.description: Title Suffix. Must be populated if ADVANCED_TITLE is on.

nameType.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name.

externalSystem.description: When name type is external, indicates the external system the name belongs to.

personNameTypeType.description: Person's name in an external system.

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

isValidated.description: Indicator to define if the Address is validated by the Address Validation System.

addressLine.description: When the address is unformatted (FormattedInd="false") these lines will contain free form address details. When the address is formatted and street number and street name must be sent independently, the street number will be sent using StreetNmbr, and the street name will be sent in the first AddressLine occurrence.

cityName.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

cityExtension.description: Post Office City Extension Code number. City Extension mainly used for UK addresses.

county.description: County or District Name (e.g., Fairfax). This is read only.

type.description: Defines the type of address (e.g. home, business, other).

primaryInd.description: When true, indicates a primary information.

updateReservations.description: Indicates whether to update the reservations or not. If true and the address is primary, then all associated active reservations will be updated with the new primary address.

barCode.description: The postal barcode for the address.

creatorId.description: ID of creator. The creator could be a software system identifier or an identifier of an employee resposible for the creation.

lastModifierId.description: Identifies the last software system or person to modify a record.

purgeDate.description: Date an item will be purged from a database (e.g., from a live database to an archive).

countryNameType.description: Code for a country or a nationality.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 200.

code.description: Code for a country or a nationality.

emailInfoType.description: Information on an email for the customer.

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

emailType.description: Information on an email for the customer.

type.description: Defines the purpose of the e-mail address (e.g. personal, business, listserve).

primaryInd.description: When true, indicates a primary information.

creatorId.description: ID of creator. The creator could be a software system identifier or an identifier of an employee resposible for the creation.

lastModifierId.description: Identifies the last software system or person to modify a record.

purgeDate.description: Date an item will be purged from a database (e.g., from a live database to an archive).

telephoneInfoType.description: Information on a telephone number for the customer.

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

telephoneType.description: Information on a telephone number for the customer.

phoneTechType.description: Indicates type of technology associated with this telephone number, such as Voice, Data, Fax, Pager, Mobile, TTY, etc.

phoneUseType.description: Describes the type of telephone number, in the context of its general use (e.g. Home, Business, Emergency Contact, Travel Arranger, Day, Evening).

phoneNumber.description: Telephone number assigned to a single location.

extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number.

primaryInd.description: When true, indicates a primary information.

creatorId.description: ID of creator. The creator could be a software system identifier or an identifier of an employee resposible for the creation.

lastModifierId.description: Identifies the last software system or person to modify a record.

purgeDate.description: Date an item will be purged from a database (e.g., from a live database to an archive).

parameterType.description: Name value pair type that will hold generic parameter information. Only use this type when the parameters being passed are too dynamic to be defined.

trackItReservationInfoType.description: Reservation info associated with a Track It item.

reservationIdList.description: Unique Id that references an object uniquely in the system.

resGuestInfoType.description: Specifies Company or Travel Agent profile using IATA or Corp. No.

membership.description: The Membership object identifying the frequent customer reward program.

namePrefix.description: Salutation of honorific. (e.g., Mr. Mrs., Ms., Miss, Dr.)

givenName.description: Given name, first name or names

alternateGivenName.description: Alternate given name, first name or names

middleName.description: The middle name of the person name

nameSuffix.description: Hold various name suffixes and letters (e.g. Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.).

nationality.description: Affiliation or ethnicity to a particular country.

vip.description: The supplier's ranking of the customer (e.g., VIP, numerical ranking).

address.description: Address information that is attached to the reservation guest

anonymization.description: Provides information about the guest's anonymization status

accompanyGuests.description: List of guest names that are accompanying the reservation guest

externalInfo.description: External information about the guest associated with the reservation.

guestLastStayInfo.description: Contains information regarding the last stay of this guest.

guestRestricted.description: True indicates there are restrictions associated with the current profile.

registrationCardNo.description: Unique identifier of the police registration card number.

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

membershipInfoType.description: The Membership object identifies the frequent customer reward program.

membershipId.description: Membership ID (Unique ID from the memberships table).

programCode.description: The code or name of the membership program ('Hertz', 'AAdvantage', etc.).

bonusCode.description: The code or name of the bonus program. BonusCode can be used to indicate the level of membership (Gold Club, Platinum member, etc.)

membershipTypeDesc.description: The description of the ProgramCode.(Delta Previlige for code DP)

membershipLevelDesc.description: The description of the Bonus Code.(Platinum for code P)

accountId.description: The account identification number for this particular member in this particular program.

membershipLevel.description: The code or name of the membership level and indicates the level of membership (Gold Club, Platinum member, etc.). This is same as the BonusCode.

playerRanking.description: Ranking assigned to the Player Profile by the Gaming system.

namePrefixType.description: Salutation of honorific. (e.g., Mr. Mrs., Ms., Miss, Dr.)

givenNameType.description: Given name, first name or names

vIPType.description: The supplier's ranking of the customer.

addressSearchType.description: Address Details such as city, state, country, postal code etc.

cityName.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

streetAddress.description: First Line of Street Address. For profile search it matches the first Address line.

excludeNoCity.description: When true indicates that only profiles with city will be fetched.

anonymizationType.description: Provides information about guest's anonymization status.

anonymizationStatus.description: Status of anonymization such as Requested or Anonymized.

anonymizationDate.description: Date and Time when the guest was anonymized.

firstName.description: Given name, first name or names

fullName.description: String representation of the full name

registrationCardNo.description: Unique identifier of the police registration card number.

profileIdList.description: Unique identifiers for the Profile for both internal and external systems. In case of Travel Agent the IATA code and in case of Company can be any form of identifier as id.
Unique Id that references an object uniquely in the system.

resGuestExternalInfoType.description: Specifies Company or Travel Agent profile using IATA or Corp. No.

givenName.description: Given name, first name or names

guestLastStayInfoType.description: Contains last stay related details of the guest.

lastStayRoom.description: Room Number where the guest stayed.

lastStayRate.description: The Rate amount of the guest's last stay.

totalStay.description: The total number of previous stay of the guest.

currencyAmountType.description: A monetary value expressed with a currency code.

currencyCode.description: Provides a currency code to reflect the currency in which an amount may be expressed.

housekeepingRoomStatusType.description: Simple type for room status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping rooms. Valid status values are Clean, Dirty, Pickup, Inspected, OutOfOrder, OutOfService.

resGuaranteeType.description: Validations type record returned after Validations are done.

pMS_ResStatusType.description: This reservation is in checked in status and the business date is past departure date. This could occur when ORS and PMS are in same environment.

trackItLogType.description: Individual activity log related to the Track It ticket.

codeType.description: Used for codes in the OPERA Code tables. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 101.EQP, or 101.EQP.X.

tags.name: CustomerManagement
tags.description: Customer Management web service caters operations for Customer Management activities.
